entry.title: Introducing Abeja
entry.content:
I only ever found a handful of emulators built for the Microbee and none were targeted at MacOS.

So I decided to roll my own

My implementation is called Abeja

Which is Spanish for bee.

It is written for MacOS Sonoma ( v14.0+ ) using Swift/SwiftUI.

Currently it doesnâ€™t do a real lot.

Whilst text display output works, only 1/3 of the Z80 instruction set is emulated.

And neither sound nor data storage functionality is present.

Subsequent posts will document how to got to this poin.

And the challenges in moving forward to a fully working implementation.
entry.summary: I only ever found a handful of emulators built for the Microbee and none were targeted at MacOS.

entry.title: Is there LifeOnMars ?
entry.content:
I had made abortive attempts at building MARS enviroments for the Microbee ( and later the PC ) but nothing ever came to fruition.

So I decided to bite the bullet and finally complete one.

My implementation is called LifeOnMars

It is written for MacOS Sonoma ( v14.0+ ) using Swift/SwiftUI.

It is more of a UI framework at this point but it will serve as a testbed for code patterns required for my other project ( Abeja )
entry.summary: I had made abortive attempts at building MARS enviroments for the Microbee ( and later the PC ) but nothing ever came to fruition.
